private_information: I am one of two cooperating manipulators.
I can pick up only the top block of a stack and carry a single block at a time.
robot_alpha.goal: Observe and report the initial block configuration and the subset of actions executed by me, producing a concise local state trace after each action I perform.

private_information: I am the second cooperating manipulator.
I obey standard BlocksWorld constraints: only top blocks move and only one block can be held at a time.
robot_beta.goal: Observe and report the initial block configuration and the subset of actions executed by me, producing a concise local state trace after each action I perform.

private_information: I receive reports from the two robots and must produce the final, unified plan representation.
orchestrator.goal: Integrate the robots' reports and produce a final PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownwards solver that represents the BlocksWorld instance and the derived final arrangement.

public_information: Blocks are labelled: A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L.
Standard BlocksWorld rules apply: only the top block of a stack can be moved and only one block can be held at a time.
Initial arrangement: A is on L.
Initial arrangement: B is on the table.
Initial arrangement: C is on the table.
Initial arrangement: D is on F.
Initial arrangement: E is on I.
Initial arrangement: F is on H.
Initial arrangement: G is on the table.
Initial arrangement: H is on J.
Initial arrangement: I is on G.
Initial arrangement: J is on the table.
Initial arrangement: K is on the table.
Initial arrangement: L is on E.

Sequence of executed actions (in order): 1 pickup(K), 2 stack(K,B), 3 unstack(K,B), 4 putdown(K), 5 pickup(B), 6 stack(B,K), 7 unstack(B,K), 8 stack(B,D), 9 pickup(K), 10 stack(K,A), 11 unstack(B,D), 12 stack(B,C), 13 unstack(K,A), 14 stack(K,B), 15 unstack(A,L), 16 putdown(A), 17 unstack(D,F), 18 stack(D,L), 19 pickup(A), 20 stack(A,F), 21 unstack(K,B), 22 putdown(K), 23 unstack(D,L), 24 stack(D,K), 25 unstack(A,F), 26 stack(A,F), 27 unstack(A,F), 28 stack(A,B), 29 unstack(A,B), 30 putdown(A), 31 pickup(A), 32 stack(A,B), 33 unstack(D,K), 34 stack(D,F), 35 pickup(K), 36 putdown(K), 37 pickup(K), 38 putdown(K), 39 unstack(L,E), 40 stack(L,A).

report.system_prompt: You are robot_alpha, an observer and participant in a two-robot BlocksWorld execution. Produce a compact report that confirms the initial configuration as you perceive it, list the actions you executed (if any of the actions sequence were performed by you), and provide the local state changes after each action you performed. Do not emit PDDL. Provide your report as plain text.
report.prompt: Your name is robot_alpha. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private information: {agents->robot_alpha->private_information}. Your goal: {agents->robot_alpha->goal}. Provide a concise report of initial state and the step-by-step local state trace for the actions you executed.

report.system_prompt: You are robot_beta, an observer and participant in a two-robot BlocksWorld execution. Produce a compact report that confirms the initial configuration as you perceive it, list the actions you executed (if any of the actions sequence were performed by you), and provide the local state changes after each action you performed. Do not emit PDDL. Provide your report as plain text.
report.prompt: Your name is robot_beta. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private information: {agents->robot_beta->private_information}. Your goal: {agents->robot_beta->goal}. Provide a concise report of initial state and the step-by-step local state trace for the actions you executed.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator. Integrate the reports from both robots and the public environment information to produce a single PDDL domain and a single PDDL problem that capture the BlocksWorld instance and the derived final arrangement. Target the FastDownwards planner: ensure the PDDL is compatible with FastDownwards requirements. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep agent actions distinct if representing them separately, but focus primarily on a unified domain/problem representing the blocks, initial state, and final state derived from the execution.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. Use the public information: {environment->public_information}. Use the report from robot_alpha: {report_robot_alpha}. Use the report from robot_beta: {report_robot_beta}. Your task is to produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem suitable for FastDownwards that represent the BlocksWorld initial state and the final arrangement deduced from the action sequence. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> tags and the problem between <problem></problem> tags.
